fixes.name: Delta Down All CCY 5Y CAD
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR base = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Delta Down T CAD] + 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Fix Value T]
RETURN
IF(
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "5 Yr" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "5 Yr Swap" ||
    (
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Market Subtype] = "Major Curve" &&
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Risk Date # of Days] > 731 &&
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Risk Date # of Days] <= 1096
    ),
    base,
    0
)
+
IF(
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "4 Yr" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "4 Yr Swap",
    2/3 * base,
    0
)
+
IF(
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "3 Yr" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "3 Yr Swap",
    1/3 * base,
    0
)
+
IF(
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "6 Yr" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "6 Yr Swap",
    4/5 * base,
    0
)
+
IF(
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "7 Yr" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "7 Yr Swap",
    3/5 * base,
    0
)
+
IF(
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "8 Yr" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "8 Yr Swap",
    2/5 * base,
    0
)
+
IF(
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "9 Yr" ||
    'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[TERM_LABEL] = "9 Yr Swap",
    1/5 * base,
    0
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the row-level Tableau IF chain into a DAX calculated column. Created VAR base for ([Delta Down T CAD] + [Fix Value T]) and reproduced each IF(...) branch with the same conditions and weighting, summing their results. Chosen as calculated_column because the formula uses only row-level fields and calculated fields (no aggregates, table calculations, LODs, or parameters).
